snippet: A caravan of book “smugglers” is heading to Arizona, where a state law led to the banning of Mexican-American studies and the teaching of such classics as “The House on Mango Street.”
abstract: Editorial applauds novelist Tony Diaz, who has decided to protest the Tucson law banning Mexican-American studies by 'smuggling' books by Latino authors into the state and holding readings with 'banned' authors at galleries, bookshops and youth centers.
lead_paragraph: A caravan of book “smugglers” is heading to Arizona, where a state law led to the banning of Mexican-American studies and the teaching of such classics as “The House on Mango Street.”
